column4: How do I mount a FAT16 volume so that I have permission to read & write to it without sudoing, like GNOME does automatically?
Crap.. how do I retrieve a file recently deleted with rm?
Come on guys... any way to get back a file removed with rm?
Is that a package...?  a man page?  I can't get to either
i'm trying to determine how it got on my system
wait crap... not FAT16... i meant... i meant ext3.  god this sucks
I'm trying recover
that's normal, but if you want, i can tell you how to get those back
To get them back, do I remove the "quiet" option in GRUB like BAzfH said?
yes, then sudo update-grub afterward
Alternately, I'd love to be able to specify, in interfaces, to not bother configuring if there's nothing plugged into the ethernet port.
BAzfH: Frankly, I think it's ridiculous that Ubuntu still has that behavior.  I was thinking of disabling it on boot entirely, and having it run on Gnome startup.
you do or don't want the boot messages?  some like quiet as default, i want as much info as possible, heh
The only reason I want the boot messages is so I can Ctrl + C out of "Configuring network interfaces..." because it hangs when I'm not plugged in.
If I can somehow specify, in /etc/networking/interfaces, to not bother with configuring if there's nothing plugged in, I'd rather do that.
ah, put the quiet back in once you find a real fix.  i had to run nosplash for a while until edgy got fixed
Where is GRUB's rc?
/boot/grub/menu.list is probably what you want
Oh, god.  The system terminal font is now horribly anti-aliased.  What's a good alternative?
not sure, i'm not a font guy
